Description: Weight: fals weight of 24 kharrūba. Six line inscription. Faint star or cross at end of legend. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: See also OA+ 4188 and OA+ 4324. From the same die: Casanova, P. 1893. Catalogue des pièces de verre des époques byzantine et arabe de la collection Fouquet. ‘Mémoires publicées par les membres de la Mission Archéologique Francaise au Caire’ VI. Paris, 29; Petrie, W.M.F. 1926. ‘Glass stamps and weights’. London, 144; Miles, G.C. 1948. ‘Early Arabic Weights and Stamps’. New York, 64; Fahmi, A. 1957. ‘Sinaj al-sikka fī fajr al-Islām’. Cairo, 110; Launois, Aimée. 1959. ‘Estampilles et poids musulmans en verre du Cabinet des Médailles’ II. Cairo, 14; Miles, G.C. 1963. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ II (I. Benaki Museum). New York, 27; Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York, 318. Cf. Casanova 1893, 30-1; Launois 1957, 169-72; Fahmi 1957, 111-6; Miles, G.C. 1958. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ I. New York, 100; Balog 1976, 317.

An extraordinary piece in the Islamic Museum in Cairo (Launois 1957, 173 = Fahmi 1957, 177) is also from the same die but has a projection with an executive counterstamp reading 'ʿalā yaday' ('at the hands of') followed by a name that has yet to be deciphered. Its weight is given by Fahmi as 6.12g., hopelessly large for 24 kharrūbas. It may be some sport that somehow left the workshop. Bibliography: Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III, 1-83; Fahmi, A. 1957. ‘Sinaj al-sikka fī fajr al-Islām’. Cairo.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (179)
Associated names: Named in inscription: 'Abd al-Malik b. Yazīd
